trailingComments.value: Match the opening angle bracket (<) in HTML tags, and HTML entities like

leadingComments.value: Match the opening angle bracket (<) in HTML tags, and HTML entities like

trailingComments.value: * Prepare props passed to `Localized` for formatting.

leadingComments.value: We'll try to match localNames of elements found in the translation with
names of elements passed as props. localNames are always lowercase.
* Prepare props passed to `Localized` for formatting.

trailingComments.value:
* The `Localized` class renders its child with translated props and children. * * *

{'Hello, world!'}

* * * The `id` prop should be the unique identifier of the translation. Any * attributes found in the translation will be applied to the wrapped element. * * Arguments to the translation can be passed as `$`-prefixed props on * `Localized`. * * *

{'Hello, { $username }!'}

* * * It's recommended that the contents of the wrapped component be a string * expression. The string will be used as the ultimate fallback if no * translation is available. It also makes it easy to grep for strings in the * source code.
Validate that the child element isn't an array

leadingComments.value: Validate that the child element isn't an array
Use the wrapped component as fallback.
Use the wrapped component as fallback.

trailingComments.value: Check if the child inside <Localized> is a valid element -- if not, then
it's either null or a simple fallback string. No need to localize the
attributes.

leadingComments.value: Replace the fallback string with the message value;
Check if the child inside <Localized> is a valid element -- if not, then
it's either null or a simple fallback string. No need to localize the
attributes.

trailingComments.value: The default is to forbid all message attributes. If the attrs prop exists
on the Localized instance, only set message attributes which have been
explicitly allowed by the developer.

leadingComments.value: The default is to forbid all message attributes. If the attrs prop exists
on the Localized instance, only set message attributes which have been
explicitly allowed by the developer.

trailingComments.value: If the wrapped component is a known void element, explicitly dismiss the
message value and do not pass it to cloneElement in order to avoid the
"void element tags must neither have `children` nor use
`dangerouslySetInnerHTML`" error.

leadingComments.value: If the wrapped component is a known void element, explicitly dismiss the
message value and do not pass it to cloneElement in order to avoid the
"void element tags must neither have `children` nor use
`dangerouslySetInnerHTML`" error.

trailingComments.value: If the message has a null value, we're only interested in its attributes.
Do not pass the null value to cloneElement as it would nuke all children
of the wrapped component.

leadingComments.value: If the message has a null value, we're only interested in its attributes.
Do not pass the null value to cloneElement as it would nuke all children
of the wrapped component.

trailingComments.value: If the message value doesn't contain any markup nor any HTML entities,
insert it as the only child of the wrapped component.

leadingComments.value: If the message value doesn't contain any markup nor any HTML entities,
insert it as the only child of the wrapped component.

trailingComments.value: If the message contains markup, parse it and try to match the children
found in the translation with the props passed to this Localized.

leadingComments.value: If the message contains markup, parse it and try to match the children
found in the translation with the props passed to this Localized.

trailingComments.value: If the child is not expected just take its textContent.

leadingComments.value: If the child is not expected just take its textContent.

trailingComments.value: If the element passed as a prop to <Localized> is a known void element,
explicitly dismiss any textContent which might have accidentally been
defined in the translation to prevent the "void element tags must not
have children" error.

leadingComments.value: If the element passed as a prop to <Localized> is a known void element,
explicitly dismiss any textContent which might have accidentally been
defined in the translation to prevent the "void element tags must not
have children" error.

* The `Localized` class renders its child with translated props and children. * * *

{'Hello, world!'}

* * * The `id` prop should be the unique identifier of the translation. Any * attributes found in the translation will be applied to the wrapped element. * * Arguments to the translation can be passed as `$`-prefixed props on * `Localized`. * * *

{'Hello, { $username }!'}

* * * It's recommended that the contents of the wrapped component be a string * expression. The string will be used as the ultimate fallback if no * translation is available. It also makes it easy to grep for strings in the * source code.

* Prepare props passed to `Localized` for formatting.
We'll try to match localNames of elements found in the translation with
names of elements passed as props. localNames are always lowercase.

* The `Localized` class renders its child with translated props and children. * * *

{'Hello, world!'}

* * * The `id` prop should be the unique identifier of the translation. Any * attributes found in the translation will be applied to the wrapped element. * * Arguments to the translation can be passed as `$`-prefixed props on * `Localized`. * * *

{'Hello, { $username }!'}

* * * It's recommended that the contents of the wrapped component be a string * expression. The string will be used as the ultimate fallback if no * translation is available. It also makes it easy to grep for strings in the * source code.
Validate that the child element isn't an array
Use the wrapped component as fallback.
Use the wrapped component as fallback.
Check if the child inside <Localized> is a valid element -- if not, then
it's either null or a simple fallback string. No need to localize the
attributes.
Replace the fallback string with the message value;
The default is to forbid all message attributes. If the attrs prop exists
on the Localized instance, only set message attributes which have been
explicitly allowed by the developer.
If the wrapped component is a known void element, explicitly dismiss the
message value and do not pass it to cloneElement in order to avoid the
"void element tags must neither have `children` nor use
`dangerouslySetInnerHTML`" error.
If the message has a null value, we're only interested in its attributes.
Do not pass the null value to cloneElement as it would nuke all children
of the wrapped component.
If the message value doesn't contain any markup nor any HTML entities,
insert it as the only child of the wrapped component.
If the message contains markup, parse it and try to match the children
found in the translation with the props passed to this Localized.
If the child is not expected just take its textContent.
If the element passed as a prop to <Localized> is a known void element,
explicitly dismiss any textContent which might have accidentally been
defined in the translation to prevent the "void element tags must not
have children" error.
